    Using wizard

    Create Degrees, Minutes and Seconds Object

    degminsec.Rd

    The function degminsec() is used to create (latitude or longitude) coordinate objects represented in degrees, minutes and seconds.

    Usage

    degminsec(x, ...)

# S3 method for default
degminsec(dms, ..., pointafter = c("deg", "min", "sec"))

# S3 method for degminsec
print(x, ...)

    Arguments

    pointafter

    a character string specifying the position of the decimal point in degminsec; must be one of "deg" (default), "min", or "sec". You can specify just the initial letter.

    degminsec

    numeric, representing a coordinate of latitude or longitude in degrees, minutes and seconds.

    Value

    An object of class "degminsec", representing a coordinate of latitude or longitude in degrees, minutes and seconds as a named list with components: -

    dd

    degrees represented by an integer with maximum absolute value of 180.

    mm

    minutes represented by a positive integer with value less than 60.

    ss

    seconds represented by a positiveinteger with value less than 60.

    Details

    degminsec() is a generic S3 function. The default method works with a numeric (double) representing a coordinate of latitude or longitude in degrees, minutes and seconds. The argument pointafter indicates the position of the decimal point, which may be placed after the degrees, the minutes or the (whole) seconds, and by default assumed to be placed after the degrees.

    See also

    Other degreeconvert: dms_to_decdeg()

    Examples

    degminsec(49.32464)
#> 
#> 	 49 degrees, 32 minutes, 46.4 seconds
degminsec(49.32464, pointafter = "deg")
#> 
#> 	 49 degrees, 32 minutes, 46.4 seconds
degminsec(4932.464, pointafter = "min")
#> 
#> 	 49 degrees, 32 minutes, 46.4 seconds
degminsec(493246.4, pointafter = "sec")
#> 
#> 	 49 degrees, 32 minutes, 46.4 seconds
